name: 2013_11_humanities_student_major_1227_gradschool
title: 2013-11-humanities-student-major_1227_GradSchool.txt
content_scrubbed:
1. In the humanities the only 'everyday' bit is the impending sense of doom that is the job market. Otherwise, we get paid so little that we're probably actually less poor, relatively speaking, than we would be if times were good. 

2. Not as bad as it was but not great, you know, except for the superfuckingrich who only give a shit about pathologically increasing their hoard of money for no logical reason. 

3. Ha. 

4. hahahahahaha. I'm in English. No matter what the economy we get treated like dirt. 

5. Japan[.] lost decade, or whatever happened to Rome during its decline.

6. Go take a poll of humanities grad students. If you can get them to give you a straight answer or not laugh in your face about this question, you'll find the answer is resoundingly "no." We don't get into this for the money which is why we're brutally exploited by the university-industrial complex. 

7. Teaching a 4/4 load as an adjunct for about $25k/year with no benefits or contract or anything; or a tenure-track position that will require working harder than I've ever worked for the chance to either be set for life or out on the street, getting me a salary that[.] perhaps marginally better than a high-school chemistry teacher.  

8. A barren wasteland.

9. I'm depressed now. I don't really expect to find a job.
